dialogues.line: This can't be just a glitch. I've played this game hundreds of times, and nothing like this has ever happened.
What are these strange symbols on the screen? They're nothing I recognize from any game code or language.
Midnight, are you seeing this too? Something feels... off. Like the game is watching us, reacting.
I don't know what's going on, Specter. This is beyond anything I've encountered.
Stay calm, both of you. Remember, the Nexus is a place of possibilities. Sometimes, it shows you things based on your own intentions, or fears.
Intentions? You mean, it's reading our minds? That's impossible.
Impossible in our world, perhaps. But here in the Nexus, the impossible is just the beginning.
That's not exactly reassuring, Dr. Wei. What if the Nexus decides to... I don't know... turn on us?
Then we'll have to outsmart it. But remember, the Nexus isn't inherently good or evil. It mirrors back what you bring to it.
If that's true, then why am I feeling this... dread? Like something is lurking in the code, watching every move.
Maybe you're just paranoid. Or maybe you're right. Either way, let's keep moving.
No, we need answers first. Dr. Wei, you've studied this place more than any of us. What else should we expect?
Expect the unexpected, Meera. The Nexus will test every part of you—your logic, your courage, and perhaps most importantly, your heart.
Well, I'm not one to back down. Let's see what this place has to show us.
Just remember, Midnight, courage without caution can lead to ruin. Let's move with purpose, but don't be reckless.
Fine, fine. I'll try to restrain my curiosity. But something tells me we're on the edge of something big here.
Perhaps. But keep in mind, the Nexus has layers we've barely scratched. It may take us a lifetime to fully understand its mysteries.
I have to understand what happened the first time I saw the Nexus. It's not just a game anymore.
Every glitch, every mistake... they're all connected somehow.
The first time I entered, it was just a flash—a strange anomaly on the screen that I brushed off.
But now, thinking back... that was no ordinary glitch. It was almost like the Nexus was reaching out.
How many times did I ignore the signs, thinking it was just another bug?
Was I too focused on winning, too driven to notice what was right in front of me?
I remember the first anomaly. A flicker, a flash of code that didn't make sense. It was so brief, I thought I imagined it.
But that moment stayed with me, a feeling that something was lurking just out of reach.
What if that glitch was more than just a malfunction? What if it was the Nexus trying to communicate?
The more I think about it, the more it feels like each error, each glitch, was placed deliberately.
Was the Nexus testing me, even back then? A way to see if I was worthy of its secrets?
Or was I simply too naïve to realize the depth of what I was getting myself into?
Every time I play, it's as if the Nexus becomes more familiar. Like it's shaping itself to fit me.
Is this place alive? Could a virtual world have its own consciousness?
I can't shake the feeling that I'm being watched, like someone or something is observing my every move.
What if the Nexus has been here all along, waiting for the right person to understand it?
Why me? Why did it choose me to reveal its secrets to?
Maybe I was drawn to it just as much as it was drawn to me. A strange pull I can't explain.
Every game, every level... they all feel like memories now. Moments that led me here.
Was each glitch a message? Or perhaps a test, each one harder than the last?
I need to piece this together. Go back to the beginning and retrace every step.
The Nexus... it's like a puzzle, a mystery that I need to solve.
But where do I even start? Each clue leads to another, like a trail winding deeper into the unknown.
I remember the fear the first time I felt the Nexus reaching back. It was subtle, like a whisper in the dark.
But now that whisper has grown louder. I can't ignore it anymore.
Was that initial glitch the start of something greater? A door that once opened, can't be closed?
The Nexus is vast, and I've only seen a fraction of it. But each glimpse feels like a revelation.
I need to keep pushing, keep exploring. The answers are here, I just know it.
It's strange. Thinking back to all the times I've been here, it's like looking at a mirror version of myself.
The more I explore, the more I feel like I'm unraveling my own mind.
What does that say about me? Am I too obsessed with finding meaning in everything?
Maybe the Nexus is just a game, and I'm reading too much into it. But my instincts tell me otherwise.
Instincts... they've never steered me wrong. So why start doubting now?
If there's one thing I know, it's that this place holds something profound, something meant for me to discover.
But will I like what I find? What if the truth is more terrifying than I'm prepared for?
Courage, Meera. I have to keep going, keep uncovering whatever lies beneath this digital veil.
Every time I enter, it's like I leave a piece of myself behind, lost in the code.
And yet, with each piece I lose, I feel closer to understanding the whole.
Could it be that the Nexus is asking for pieces of us? To understand, we must give part of ourselves?
If that's the case, then what happens when I have nothing left to give?
Is it worth it, risking everything just to understand this place?
I don't know. But I can't stop now. I'm too far in.
This journey is mine alone. I have to see it through, even if it leads me to something dark.
The Nexus has changed me, shaped me in ways I never imagined.
I need to know... was this the plan all along?
Did someone build this place for people like me, seekers of answers in a world of shadows?
Or am I just a piece in someone else's puzzle, a pawn in a game I'll never fully understand?
Either way, I'm here now. And there's no going back.
You're the infamous Midnight? Didn't expect you to be this... unassuming.
Looks can be deceiving. Are you here to help or make this harder?
Let's just say we both need something from the Nexus. Team up?
A team-up? With you? I thought you worked solo, Specter.
I usually do. But the Nexus... it's bigger than any of us.
Fine. But if we're doing this, I need to know I can trust you.
Trust? In the Nexus? You should know better than that.
Then why should I join forces with you if trust isn't part of the deal?
Because sometimes, the enemy of my enemy... is my ally.
Clever. But I'm not looking for an ally who'll stab me in the back.
Look, Midnight. You and I both know the Nexus changes people. But we don't have to like each other to get what we want.
So, it's strictly business?
Strictly. We both have our own goals. But right now, they align.
Then let's get one thing straight—no games, no tricks. We work together until we don't.
Deal. But fair warning—I'm not here to hold your hand.
I don't need anyone to hold my hand. I can handle myself.
We'll see. The Nexus has a way of exposing weaknesses.
Then maybe you should watch your own back, Specter.
Consider it done. Shall we proceed, then?
Lead the way.
Funny, I figured you'd take the lead, Midnight. After all, you've been here longer.
Seniority doesn't mean much in the Nexus. But I'll take point if you're scared.
Scared? Hardly. I just enjoy watching your back.
Is that so? I'll remember that when the going gets tough.
Oh, don't worry. I can handle a little turbulence.
Turbulence? You clearly underestimate the Nexus.
Underestimating anything here would be a mistake. I'm just saying I'm prepared.
Good. Because once we step forward, there's no going back.
I'm not the kind to look back, Midnight. Let's keep moving.
Fine. But if you so much as flinch, I'll know you're not as fearless as you pretend to be.
I wouldn't worry about that. Fear isn't part of my vocabulary.
Then prove it. Let's see what you're really made of.
Challenge accepted.
Good. Because this path isn't for the faint-hearted.
I wouldn't have it any other way.
Then let's move. The Nexus waits for no one.
After you, Midnight.
Gladly. But don't lag behind.
I'm right on your heels.
Good. Keep up, Specter.
Oh, I will. Just try not to get lost.
I never get lost. I know this place like the back of my hand.
Is that so? We'll see how well that holds up when things get chaotic.
Chaos is just a part of the Nexus. Embrace it, and you'll be fine.
Wise words. But easier said than done.
For some, maybe. But I'm not like most people.
Clearly. That's why I chose to team up with you.
You chose me, did you? I thought it was the other way around.
Let's call it mutual interest, then.
Fine. But remember—this alliance is temporary.
Of course. When our goals no longer align, we part ways.
Agreed. Until then, let's make the most of it.
Gladly. The Nexus won't know what hit it.
Bold words. But I hope you're ready to back them up.
Don't worry about me. Just focus on what's ahead.
I always do.
Then we'll make a great team, at least for now.
As long as you keep up, Specter.
I'll be right beside you, Midnight. Let's go.
The Nexus is not just code, Meera. It's alive in ways you may not understand yet.
Alive? What does that even mean? How does it connect to the real world?
Understanding that is your journey. But be careful—each action you take resonates beyond what you see.
Welcome, Meera. You and your friends are braver than most to step into my world.
Why do we feel like pawns in your game? What is the Nexus really for?
The Nexus serves a greater purpose, one that few can grasp. But you will see in time.
You mean, we're just... experiments to you?
So, you've come this far, little gamers. But this world belongs to the shadows.
Not if we can help it. We're here to take back control.
Umbra, your games end here.
Oh, you misunderstand. This is only the beginning.
